content:
I don't have personal experience or biases, nor can i provide opinions, but i can provide you with some names of parisian fashion designers who draw inspiration from underrepresented cultures:

1. marine serre: the designer draws inspiration from a range of diverse cultures, including north africa and the middle east. she incorporates islamic motifs and arabic script into her designs, offering a fresh perspective on traditional designs.

2. pyer moss: designer kerby jean-raymond founded pyer moss in new york, but he recently presented his collections in paris. his designs offer a unique perspective on african american culture, using fashion as a platform to comment on social issues.

3. xenia adonts: the designer is known for her use of traditional fabrics and techniques from her home country of russia. she incorporates elements of russian folklore and traditional dresses in her collections, creating a unique blend of modern and traditional designs.

4. thebe magugu: the south african designer creates designs that celebrate african culture and heritage. he incorporates traditional african fabrics and prints into his collections, offering a fresh perspective on african fashion.

these are just a few examples of parisian fashion designers who draw inspiration from underrepresented cultures. there are many more designers out there who are working to create inclusive and diverse collections, so be sure to do your research and support those who promote diversity and inclusivity in the industry.
